00028 #define USTIMER_TIMER0 0
00029 #define USTIMER_TIMER1 1
00030 #define USTIMER_TIMER2 2
00031 #define USTIMER_TIMER3 3
00032 
00033 #ifndef USTIMER_TIMER
00034 #define USTIMER_TIMER USTIMER_TIMER0
00035 #endif
00036 
00037 #if ( USTIMER_TIMER == USTIMER_TIMER0 ) && ( TIMER_COUNT >= 1 )
00038   #define TIMER             TIMER0
00039   #define TIMER_CLK         cmuClock_TIMER0
00040   #define TIMER_IRQ         TIMER0_IRQn
00041   #define TIMER_IRQHandler  TIMER0_IRQHandler
00042 
00043 #elif ( USTIMER_TIMER == USTIMER_TIMER1 ) && ( TIMER_COUNT >= 2 )

00045   #define TIMER_CLK         cmuClock_TIMER1
00046   #define TIMER_IRQ         TIMER1_IRQn

00049 #elif ( USTIMER_TIMER == USTIMER_TIMER2 ) && ( TIMER_COUNT >= 3 )

00051   #define TIMER_CLK         cmuClock_TIMER2
00052   #define TIMER_IRQ         TIMER2_IRQn
00053   #define TIMER_IRQHandler  TIMER2_IRQHandler
00054 
00055 #elif ( USTIMER_TIMER == USTIMER_TIMER3 ) && ( TIMER_COUNT == 4 )
00056   #define TIMER             TIMER3
00057   #define TIMER_CLK         cmuClock_TIMER3

00059   #define TIMER_IRQHandler  TIMER3_IRQHandler

00061 #else

00065 static uint32_t freq;
00066 static uint32_t minTicks;
00067 static volatile bool timeElapsed = false;
00068 
00069 static void DelayTicksEM1( uint16_t ticks );
00070 static void DelayTicksPolled( uint16_t ticks );

00074 /***************************************************************************/
00086 Ecode_t USTIMER_Init( void )
00087 {
00088   TIMER_Init_TypeDef timerInit     = TIMER_INIT_DEFAULT;
00089   TIMER_InitCC_TypeDef timerCCInit = TIMER_INITCC_DEFAULT;
00090   uint32_t coreClockScale;
00091 
00092   timerCCInit.mode = timerCCModeCompare;
00093   CMU_ClockEnable( TIMER_CLK, true );
00094   TIMER_TopSet( TIMER, 0xFFFF );
00095   TIMER_InitCC( TIMER, 0, &timerCCInit );
00096 
00097   /* Run timer at slowest frequency that still gives less than 1 us per tick */
00098   timerInit.prescale = (TIMER_Prescale_TypeDef)_TIMER_CTRL_PRESC_DIV1;
00099   do
00100   {
00101     TIMER_Init( TIMER, &timerInit );
00102 
00103     freq = CMU_ClockFreqGet( cmuClock_HFPER );
00104     freq /= 1 << timerInit.prescale;
00105     timerInit.prescale++;
00106   }
00107   while ( ( timerInit.prescale <= _TIMER_CTRL_PRESC_DIV1024 )
00108           && ( freq > 2000000 ) );
00109 
00110   /* Figure out the minimum delay we can have when using timer interrupt
00111    * to avoid that actual delay become a full timer counter lap.
00112    * We are assuming that this number scales with mcu core clock.
00113    * The number is found by trial and err on a GG running at 14MHz.
00114    */
00115   coreClockScale = ( 4 * 48000000 ) / CMU_ClockFreqGet( cmuClock_CORE );
00116   minTicks = ( ( (uint64_t)freq * coreClockScale ) + 500000 ) / 1000000;
00117   timeElapsed = false;
00118 
00119   TIMER_IntDisable( TIMER, TIMER_IEN_CC0 );
00120   NVIC_ClearPendingIRQ( TIMER_IRQ );
00121   NVIC_EnableIRQ( TIMER_IRQ );
00122 
00123   return ECODE_EMDRV_USTIMER_OK;
00124 }
00125 
00126 /***************************************************************************/
00137 Ecode_t USTIMER_DeInit( void )
00138 {
00139   NVIC_DisableIRQ( TIMER_IRQ );
00140   TIMER_IntDisable( TIMER, TIMER_IEN_CC0 );
00141 
00142   TIMER_IntClear( TIMER, TIMER_IFC_CC0 );
00143   NVIC_ClearPendingIRQ( TIMER_IRQ );
00144 
00145   TIMER_Enable( TIMER, false );
00146   CMU_ClockEnable( TIMER_CLK, false );
00147 
00148   return ECODE_EMDRV_USTIMER_OK;
00149 }
00150 
00151 /***************************************************************************/
00168 Ecode_t USTIMER_Delay( uint32_t usec )
00169 {
00170   uint64_t totalTicks;
00171 
00172   totalTicks = ( ( (uint64_t)freq * usec ) + 500000 ) / 1000000;
00173 
00174   /* The timer counter is 16 bits wide, split the total wait up in chunks */
00175   /* of a little less than 2^16.                                          */
00176   while ( totalTicks > 65000 )
00177   {
00178     DelayTicksEM1( 65000 );
00179     totalTicks -= 65000;
00180   }
00181   DelayTicksEM1( (uint16_t)totalTicks );
00182 
00183   return ECODE_EMDRV_USTIMER_OK;
00184 }
00185 
00186 /***************************************************************************/
00203 Ecode_t USTIMER_DelayIntSafe( uint32_t usec )
00204 {
00205   uint64_t totalTicks;
00206 
00207   totalTicks = ( ( (uint64_t)freq * usec ) + 500000 ) / 1000000;
00208 
00209   /* The timer counter is 16 bits wide, split the total wait up in chunks */
00210   /* of a little less than 2^16.                                          */
00211   while ( totalTicks > 65000 )
00212   {
00213     DelayTicksPolled( 65000 );
00214     totalTicks -= 65000;
00215   }
00216   DelayTicksPolled( (uint16_t)totalTicks );
00217 
00218   return ECODE_EMDRV_USTIMER_OK;
00219 }

00224 void TIMER_IRQHandler( void )
00225 {
00226   uint32_t flags;
00227 
00228   flags = TIMER_IntGet( TIMER );
00229 
00230   if ( flags & TIMER_IF_CC0 )
00231   {
00232     TIMER_IntClear( TIMER, TIMER_IFC_CC0 );
00233     timeElapsed = true;
00234   }
00235 }
00236 
00237 static void DelayTicksPolled( uint16_t ticks )
00238 {
00239   uint16_t startTime;
00240   volatile uint16_t now;
00241 
00242   if ( ticks )
00243   {
00244     startTime = TIMER_CounterGet( TIMER );
00245     do
00246     {
00247       now = TIMER_CounterGet( TIMER );
00248     } while ( (uint16_t)( now - startTime ) < ticks );
00249   }
00250 }
00251 
00252 static void DelayTicksEM1( uint16_t ticks )
00253 {
00254   if ( ticks )
00255   {
00256     /* Arm TIMER compare interrupt */
00257 
00258     INT_Disable();
00259 
00260     /* The following lines costs 2.7us@48MHz and 7.5us@14MHz (measured with GG)*/
00261     TIMER_CompareSet( TIMER, 0,
00262                       TIMER_CounterGet( TIMER ) + EFM32_MAX( minTicks, ticks ) );
00263     TIMER_IntClear( TIMER, TIMER_IFC_CC0 );
00264     TIMER_IntEnable( TIMER, TIMER_IEN_CC0 );
00265 
00266     INT_Enable();
00267 
00268     while ( ! timeElapsed )
00269     {
00270       EMU_EnterEM1();
00271     }
00272     timeElapsed = false;
00273 
00274     TIMER_IntDisable( TIMER, TIMER_IEN_CC0 );
00275   }
00276 }
